Judul: Exhibiting Women���s Handicrafts: Arts and Crafts Exhibitions in Greece at the Dawn of the Twentieth Century
Abstrak:
Since the nineteenth century, women have participated in national and international
exhibitions as exhibitors, as visitors and as objects on display.They have also used
the exhibitions as a medium for the construction of female identity, as an occasion for
claiming a share of public responsibility and as a site for entering the public, previously
masculine sphere. This article explores the impact of these major international events
on women from smaller countries such as Greece, arguing that these exhibitions offered
women model content, aims and forms for demonstrating female accomplishments,
which women then further employed and transformed to work on the national as well
as the international stage.
Sumber: Gender & History, Vol.26 No.2 August 2014, pp. 287–312
